div.l: ¶ Now telle on genttell roger be thy name
But yit I preye thee bee nowt wrooht for game
A man may seye full sooht in gamen ⁊and īn play
Thow seyist full sooht quod Roger bee my fay
But sooht pley quade pley as thee flemyngꝭe seyht
And ther fore henry Baily bee thy feyht
¶ Bee thow nowght wrooht ore wee deꝑparte heere
Thowgh that my tale bee offe an Oostellere
But natheles I wille nowt telle it yit
But erwe departe I wis thow schalt been quit
And ther wᵗith all hee lowgh and made glad chere
And seyde his tale as yee schall after here
A prentyis whilvm dwelde in owre Citee
And of a craft offe vetaleris was hee
Gaylard he was as gold fynch in the schawe
Brown as any berie a propre schort felawe
Whit lockis blake I kempt full fetisly
Dawnce hee cowthe so weell and iolily
That hee was klepyd perkyn Revelowr
And hee was as full of love as a ꝑparamowr
As is thee hyve full of hony swete
Weell was thee wenche wᵗith hym myghtte mete
¶ Atte every bridale wolde hee syngge ⁊and hoppe
Hee louede better thee taverne thānne the schoppe
Fore whanne any Rydingge was in chepe
Owt of thee schoppe thader wolde hee lepe
Tille that hee hadde all thee syghtte seyin
And dawnsed full weell wolde hee not comēn agayn
And hee wolde gadren hym a meyne of his sort
To hoppen and synggen and maken swich desport
And there they setten stevene forto mete
To pleyen atte thee dyis in swiche a strete
¶ Fore in thee town nas there no prentyis
That feyrere cowde caste a peyre of dyis
Thanne ꝑperkyn cowthe and therto was hee free
Offe his desspencis in place of previtee
That foonde his Mayster weell īn his chaffare
For often tyme hee fond his box full bare
For sekerly a prentyis Reuelowr
¶ That hawntyht dyis riot or paramour
His Mayster schall it in his schoppe a beye
All have hee nowt part offe thee menstralcye
For thefte ⁊and riot they been convertible
All cvnne hee pleye on geterne ore rubible
Revell and trowthe they been īn svndry degree
They been full wroht all day as men may see
¶ This ioly prentyis wᵗith his Mayister a boode
Till hee were neer owt of his prentyishode
All were he snybbid bothe erlye and latee
And svmtyme lad wᵗith revell vnto Newegate
But atte thee laste his Mayster hym be thowghtte
Vppon a day whane hee his paper sowghtte
Of a ꝓproverbe that seyght this same word
Well bettere is roten appull owt offe hord
Thanne that it rotye alle thee remnawnt

div.l: Hit is full lasce harm to late it awey pasce
Thānne hee schende all the remnawnt īn the place
¶ Therfore his Mayister yaf hym a quietawnce
And bad hym goo wᵗith sorwe and Meschawnce
And thus this ioly prēntyis hadde his leve
Now late hym riote all nyght or leue
And for theer is no theef wᵗith owten a lowke
That helpyht hym to wasten ⁊and to sowke
Offe that hee bribe can ore borwen May
Annon hee sentte his bed ⁊and his array
Vnto annother cvmpeer offe his owne soort
That louede dyis and revell ⁊and swich desport
And hadde a wyif that heeld forht cvntenawnce
A schoppe and swivede for here svstinawnce
¶ Explicit the cokis tale
¶ Here bee gynnyht Gamelyn
Lythes and lestenyht ⁊and herkenyht a Ryght
And yee yee schall here of a dowghty knyght
Sire Iohn of Boundis was his name
Hee cowde of norture and moche of game
Thre sonis thee knyght hadde ⁊and wᵗith his body wan
The eldeste was a moche schrewe ⁊and sone he began
